text: The 1761 English cricket season was the 18th season following the earliest known codification of the Laws of Cricket. Details have survived of four eleven-a-side matches between significant teams. ==Matches== Four eleven-a- side match between significant teams are known to have taken place.ACS, p.22.Other matches in England 1761, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2019-02-10. *27 June - Essex v Kent - Billericay *1 July - Chertsey v Dartford - Laleham Burway *31 August - Richmond v Chertsey - Richmond Green *28 September - Chertsey v Hampton - Laleham Burway ==Other events== George Smith, who had been the keeper of the Artillery Ground in London, died at Marlborough in June.Buckley. The first match known to have taken place in the Leeds area was reported by the Leeds Intelligencer in July. ==References== ==Bibliography== * * ==Further reading== * * * * * * Category:1761 in English cricket Category:English cricket seasons from 1598 to 1763
title: 1761 English cricket season
